title: Flight 93 National Memorial: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth       Explore - Learn - Protect Helping Children Understand Flight 93 Flight 93 National Memorial recognizes children may struggle to understand what happened on September 11, 2001, especially since adults also struggle to understand the events of that day. With assistance from our partners in education, a less complicated narrative of the Flight 93 story was developed to help adults better explain what happened here. Ask for the children's version of the Flight 93 story at the Visitor Center (coming soon for web).    Junior Ranger Program This program is designed for children ages 6-12 making a visit to Flight 93 National Memorial.  Children can explore the memorial and learn about Flight 93 through 11 activities of varying difficulty. The program also provides a  narrative to help explain the Flight 93 story to younger audiences. The Junior Ranger Program is available upon request at the Visitor Center and at the Memorial Plaza. Explore special NPS Centennial Junior Ranger opportunities.  Partners in Education University of Pittsburgh Flight 93 Research Team The Fred Rogers Company Highmark Caring Place Friends of Flight 93 National Memorial
